title: Abandoned and Emergency Bicycle Removal | Transportation | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: In an effort to keep UIC safe and clean, university staff has the authority to remove abandoned bicycles or issue an emergency bicycle removal in case a safety hazard is presented.
What constitutes an emergency safety hazard?
What constitutes a potential safety hazard?
How do I report an abandoned bike or a bike that is a safety hazard?
What happens if my bike has been identified as abandoned or a safety hazard?
In all cases, you will need to call the UIC Warehouse at (312) 996-2877 to schedule an appointment to retrieve your bicycle. To retrieve your bicycle you will need to provide:
If your bicycle has been stored for more than two (2) weeks, a $20.00 storage fee per month will be assessed. This fee should be paid by a check made payable to the University of Illinois.
If you wish to appeal this fee, please contact Pablo Acevedo, Associate Director, Facilities Management, Transportation at acevedop@uic.edu.
All bicycles will be purged from storage no less than 90 days after they have been collected. UIC is neither responsible nor liable for any bicycle that has been purged from storage after 90 days.
